text: I like the George Romero films, which were really great, social satire movies really twisted.
author: John Cusack

text: I love these movies where it's just about the film. You don't have my face on the poster. It's all about the movie. I like that.
author: John Cusack

text: It seems to me that one thing people do over and over again is try to figure out how to get married, stay married, fall in love, how to rekindle all this stuff. It seems to me to be a pretty eternal theme so I don't know if you can get typecast from making movies about men relating to women. It seems to be what is going on on the planet a lot.
author: John Cusack

text: The movies have got more corporate, they're making fewer movies in general, and those they are making are all $200-$300m tent-pole releases that eat up all the oxygen.
author: John Cusack

text: Usually I do everything reverse. I practice something in movies and then I try it in real life.
author: John Cusack
